channel.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
channel.description:
As some of you will know, my latest online venture is into the world of free web hosting. My company, launching very soon, will be providing excellent service, a secure and stable environment, awesome uptime, and a level of support previously unrivalled in the hosting world - and we will be offering it for free. :)
However, now all the business side of the planning has been sorted, I've run into a little hitch with the software planning. As a lot of you are into web development, I thought I would ask here. My question is this: do you see CPanel as a nessecary for your hosting, or are you willing to use other panels? Do you prefer CPanel, or are you not bothered? I ask this because CPanel is undoubtably the "standard", however from an administration point of view it is not my preferred panel. I am unsure whether to offer it or a lesser known panel (I have my favourites already).
Would you be happy to see a decent free CPanel host?
Feedback wanted.

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Oh, I will definitely be offering some sort of control panel. I was just curious whether in peoples eyes it HAD to be CPanel, or any of the alternatives were just as good to them.

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

Fantastico requires CPanel.
And recuires a good site owner, so no andrew XD I think Cpanels are recuired, without that I can´t go to my site lol. Well Ftp is a recuirement also I think :p

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

I much prefer cPanel hosting services. If it doesn’t have cPanel, I don’t use it, because it generally doesn’t work properly for what I need.

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I will admit DirectAdmin licences and probably other control panels are much cheaper, but that isn’t the only reason I ask really… I could get a CPanel licence if would improve the quality of the host in others’ eyes. However, most people that have seen the backend of CPanel agree that it is an ugly sight.

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

i was under the impression cpanel licences are kind of costly.

Which is why he’s asking around to see if it is a necessity.

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Well, if you wish, you can.

The free package will be ad-supported, however with the possibility of you sharing the money your ad makes with us. The idea being, most people put some form of ad on their pages anyway, and usually to cover their hosting costs, so really, nothing is different from a paid host.

However, for those who want more resources and full control over ads, the account can be upgraded for a small fee.

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Why free? I would be willing to pay a small sum.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

pookey71:

Just as long and we get fantastico i don’t care.

Fantastico requires CPanel.

However, both of the other panels I have in mind also have installer scripts available.

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:68080”][quote author=leader link=topic=99621.msg1017497#msg1017497 date=1174019107]
There are a lot of expenses in the web hosting business depending on what you provide.
[/quote]

You’re not wrong!

I’m not new to the hosting game, just the free ones ;)[/quote]

So, how much did you spend on this free hosting website or other hosting websites?

Read full topic

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

How much space and bandwidth will the hosting package provide? There are a lot of expenses in the web hosting business depending on what you provide. However, good luck with your soon-to-come business.

If you want to be shorter on competition then try Plesk instead of Cpanel. It is pretty good, but costs more, I believe.

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?

item.title: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I would say yes, CPanel is standard, and is most easiest to work with. Does it matter if it doesn’t have CPanel? No. As long as we get another alternative control panel that we, administrators, can work from, I’d be most happy. Unfortunately, a lot of people would love to have CPanel, and seeing as there are other free hosters that offer it, you may have a bit of competition :\

Goodluck with it all though <3

Read full topic
item.source: Is CPanel a requirement for your hosting?
